app_subtitle: A web UI based on udp2raw
enable_service_hint: Master switch. If disabled, no tunnels will run.
keep_iptables_hint: Auto-restore iptables rules if cleared by system. Recommended.
wait_iptables_hint: Wait for xtables lock while invoking iptables. Prevents failures during boot.
retry_on_error_hint: Allow starting even if network is not ready. Recommended for auto-start.
server_desc: Server Mode: OpenWrt listens for connections from remote clients.
server_traffic_flow: Traffic Flow: Internet → WAN Port → [Decrypted] → Forward To IP:Port.
client_desc: Client Mode: OpenWrt connects to remote udp2raw server (VPS).
client_traffic_flow: Traffic Flow: App → Local Port → [Encrypted] → Forward To VPS IP:Port.
name: Name
wan_listen_address_hint: Address to listen on. Use 0.0.0.0 for all interfaces.
local_listen_address_hint: IP to bind locally. Use 127.0.0.1 for local apps (WireGuard/OpenVPN).
password_hint: Encryption password. Must match client configuration exactly.
raw_mode_hint: Transport protocol. FakeTCP is recommended for bypassing firewalls.
cipher_mode_hint: Encryption method. XOR is fast and usually sufficient.
auth_mode_hint: Authentication method. Simple is basic protection.
source_ip_hint: Force source-ip for raw socket. Leave empty unless necessary.
source_port_hint: Force source-port for raw socket. Disables port changing. Leave empty unless necessary.
auto_iptables_hint: Automatically add iptables rules to block kernel TCP processing. Required for FakeTCP.
safety_faketcp: FakeTCP mode REQUIRES iptables rules to block kernel TCP RST packets.
safety_openwrt: On OpenWrt, iptables rules may be cleared when network settings change.
safety_recommend: The "Keep Iptables Rules" option is STRONGLY recommended for OpenWrt.
safety_server: Server Mode: You MUST specify "Forward To" address (usually 127.0.0.1).
